Comment.MultiLanguageText: Super Heat Temperature that reduces Control Ampfication by 64%

LineComment.Text: Set expansion valve to manual setpoint
Set expansion valves to fixed opening on startup
###CHANGE: The function to close the expansion valve if the compressor is stopped in dryout.
###CHANGE: Added the flag "DB_Regulators".PurgeControl.bDone = 0 since in state 4, in dyout (after purge), the "DB_Regulators".PurgeControl.bSpinning is zero but the comperssor is turning again.
###CHANGE: New function TO limit massflow on dryout with already filled evaporator at evaporation pressure > 300kPa.
300kPa is larger than dryout pressure and sat at ~minimalinlet temperature. // 300kPa should be auto calculated or part of the dataset
###Note: With more than 300kPa we can assume that the evaporator is still filled and an additional amount of refrigerant would not be helpful
Close expansion valve if inactive
Inactivate PID controler if a upper condition is fulfilled. Controler is reset to current output if true

AttributeList.Text: ###CHANGE: Added complete network: If the controller is inactive and the expansion valve and the controller is set to an fixed value.

LineComment.Text: Setpoint is the pinch from the superheat regulator
Additional superheat
Pilot-control-filter to bypass additional superheat to the pinch controller
Preliminary setpoint modification to counteract source temperature changes
Maximum compensation is 75% of unmodified Setpoint
The internal value of the DT1-Block is also corrected by the leftover to enable a rapid response in case of a change of direction.
#DT1_Merker_intern -= #AddPinch_RateOfSourceChange + 0.75 * #DB_Regulators.ExpansionValve.fSetpoint;
To avoid overcorrection the temperature change correction is limited to the left 25%.
The control error is the difference between current pinch value and pinch setpoint.
Maximum suction pressure protection

The target evaporation temperature should ensure a boiling pressure of no more than 1000 kPa (Maximum Limit - 100kPa). For this purpose, the control error is limited in case of a high evaporation pressure/temperature.
Current pressure target for visualisation and debugging
Adapt Pinch control Kp-factor:

We need this function because an unloaded ("empty") evaporator reacts very sensitively to a changed refrigerant quantity. Empty or unloaded always means relatively much superheat, so that we can fine-tune it with this value.

The Kp factor depends on the Superheat after the Evaporator. If there is much superheat, the kp is smaller and if the superheat gets to zero it gets closer to the preset factor (3.0). A superheat of #EXP_VLV_PID_CALMING (14K) reduces Kp by 64% and a superheat of 2*#EXP_VLV_PID_CALMING reduces the Kp by 86%.
The Lower limit for the expansion valve position can be increased on warmup
To ensure a minimal "heat" flow a minimal leakage might be helpful
Mode

AttributeList.Text: Pinch setpoint to expansion valve position
